  • Constructor Details

    • DisjointSets

      public DisjointSets()
      DisjointSets Constructor creates an empty DisjointSets

  • Method Details

    • createSet

      public boolean createSet(T u)
      Creates a unique set that contains the specified puzzleElement. If the specified puzzleElement is null or another set already contains that puzzleElement, this method returns false, indicating that a set was not created
      Parameters:
      u - puzzleElement to create the set from
      Returns:
      true if the set was created, false otherwise

    • find

      public T find(T p)
      Finds and returns the representative set puzzleElement of the set that the specified puzzleElement contains
      Parameters:
      p - puzzleElement of the set of which to find
      Returns:
      representative set puzzleElement or null if the specified puzzleElement is null or is not in the DisjointSets

    • union

      public boolean union(T p, T q)
      Unions two sets together. If the set are non-null and disjoint, then it returns true, false otherwise
      Parameters:
      p - set one
      q - set two
      Returns:
      returns true if sets are non-null and disjoint, false otherwise

    • addAndUnion

      public void addAndUnion(T p, T q)
      Unions to elements together, if either puzzleElement is not already in the DisjointSets, it creates a set for the puzzleElement then unions the sets together. If either puzzleElement is null, no action is taken.
      Parameters:
      p - puzzleElement one
      q - puzzleElement two

    • contains

      public boolean contains(T u)
      Determines whether the specified puzzleElement is in the DisjointSets
      Parameters:
      u - puzzleElement to check
      Returns:
      true if the DisjointSets contains the specified puzzleElement, false otherwise

    • getSet

      public Set<T> getSet(T p)
      Gets the set of elements that the specified puzzleElement is contained in, or null if no such set exists.
      Parameters:
      p - puzzleElement to get the set of
      Returns:
      the set of elements that the specified puzzleElement if contained in, or null if no such set exists

    • getAllSets

      public List<Set<T>> getAllSets()
      Gets a list of all of the sets in the DisjointSets
      Returns:
      list of the sets in the DisjointSets

    • setCount

      public int setCount()
      Gets the number of disjoint sets
      Returns:
      the number of disjoint sets

    • size

      public int size()
      Gets the total number of elements among all sets in the DisjointSets
      Returns:
      the number of elements in the DisjointSets
